text:
Arunachal Pradesh Governor Jyoti Prashad Rajkhowa has said he would soon recommend certain cases in the State for investigation by either the CBI or the NIA.

“Specific cases would be directed to be sent to NIA and CBI at the earliest,” he told representatives of Jan Andholan Committee and People’s Party of Arunachal who called on him at Raj Bhavan on Saturday. “Necessary action is being initiated against the officials responsible for the derailing of the administration and breakdown of law and order,” a Raj Bhavan release said. On the President’s Rule, he said it “is only an emergency measure and a temporary phase. Sooner or later, a democratically-elected government will be here.” — PTI
title: ‘Some cases to be sent to CBI’
